Class CotDetail

  • java.lang.Object

    public class CotDetail
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.os.Parcelable
    A Cursor on Target root detail tag or sub tag

      • getInnerText

        public java.lang.String getInnerText()
        Get the inner text of the tag if any. This does not return XML representation of sub tags. Inner-text and sub-tags are mutually exclusive.
        Returns:
        the inner text of the tag

      • getAttributes

        public CotAttribute[] getAttributes()
        Get an array of the immutable attributes of the detail tag. The order is the same as the add order.
        Returns:
        get a copy of the current attributes.

      • getChild

        public CotDetail getChild(java.lang.String name)
        Get the first child detail with the given name This is a shortcut method for getFirstChildByName(int, String) which is more verbose
        Parameters:
        name - Detail name
        Returns:
        CoT detail or null if not found

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<CotDetail> getChildren()
        Get a list of this CoT's children This is much faster than calling getChild(int) in a loop
        Returns:
        List of child nodes

      • setAttribute

        public void setAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String value)
        Set an attribute. There is no need to do any special escaping of the value. When an XML string is built, escaping of illegal characters is done automatically.
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute name
        value - the value

      • addChild

        public void addChild(CotDetail detail)
        Add a sub detail tag. Since sub tags and inner text are mutually exclusive, a successful calling will clear any inner text.
        Parameters:
        detail -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if detail is null

        Throws:

        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of bounds

        Remove a child.

      • setInnerText

        public void setInnerText(java.lang.String text)
        Set the inner text of this tag. Since sub tags and inner text are mutually exclusive, calling this removes any sub tags
        Parameters:
        text -
